I\'d love to recommend a movie that fits your taste. Can you tell me a bit about what you\'re in the mood for? Do you have a preferred genre or type of movie?\nSeeker: Hi! I\'m so glad you asked. I\'ve been in the mood for something that\'s a bit more thought-provoking. You know, something that makes me think about life and the world around me. I\'ve been really into movies that explore social issues and have strong characters.\nRecommender: That sounds like a great starting point! Thought-provoking movies can be really impactful. Can you tell me a bit about your movie-watching experience? Have you seen any movies recently that you really enjoyed or disliked?\nSeeker: Actually, I just watched "The Help" with my book club. We all loved it, but I have to say, I was a bit disappointed by the ending. I felt like it was a bit too simplistic. But overall, it was a great discussion starter.\nRecommender: I\'m glad you shared that with me. It sounds like you appreciate movies that spark interesting discussions and have complex themes. Can you tell me more about what you mean by "strong characters"? Are you looking for characters that are well-developed, relatable, or perhaps flawed in some way?\nSeeker: Exactly! I love characters that are multi-dimensional and relatable. I want to feel like I can learn from them or see myself in them. And yes, flaws are a must! I think that\'s what makes characters so believable and interesting.\nRecommender: I think I\'m getting a good sense of what you\'re looking for. The main character, Louis Stevens, is a complex and multi-dimensional character who is struggling to find his place in the world.\nSeeker: That sounds interesting. I\'m intrigued by the themes you mentioned. But can you tell me more about the plot? What happens in the movie?\nRecommender: The movie follows Louis Stevens, a former Special Forces soldier, as he returns to his high school to find it overrun by drugs and violence. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation. (Such as asking the Recommender to tell more about the recommended item. )\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation. (Only if the Seeker has explicitly indicated acceptance, such as stating they will try watching it, you can consider the recommendation as accepted.)\n\nPlease make sure your response is only one of the five options, and output corresponding sentence without contents in the brackets and without any other words.\n\nThe conversation history is as follows: \nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi! I\'m here to help you find a great movie. What kind of movies are you in the mood for?\nSeeker: Hi. I\'m not really sure. I\'ve been watching a lot of sci-fi lately, but I\'m open to other genres. What do you have in mind?\nRecommender: I have a few options that might interest you. However, I need a bit more information about your preferences.
